title.narrative: Energy Resources and Sustainability Master Plan for Tocumen International Airport, through CH2M HILL, Inc.

description.narrative: The purpose of the Energy Resources and Airport Sustainability Master Plan for Tocumen International Airport is to support energy and environmental sustainability improvements to Panama's main airport. This project will offer commercial opportunities for a range of goods and services from the United States, including energy generation equipment, energy efficiency technologies, and engineering services.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Global Procurement Initiative: Procurement Assistance Program for Panama: Phase III Procurement Advisors, through Ernst & Young LLP

description.narrative: This technical assistance grant provides funding for a Procurement Advisor and a Technical Transportation Procurement Expert, collectively referred to as Advisors, to assist Panama's Ministry of Public Works (MOP) for a period of 18 months. The grant represents Phase III of the Procurement Assistance Program for Panama under the Global Procurement Initiative. The Advisors will provide strategic and technical procurement advice, with the goal of incorporating value-based methodologies into MOP's procurement processes. A value-based procurement system will help MOP implement sustainable, high-quality infrastructure projects and may increase opportunities for U.S. companies to bid on and potentially win tenders.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Global Procurement Initiative: Procurement Assistance Program for Panama: Phase III Procurement Advisors Technical Assistance, through Ernst & Young LLP

description.narrative: This technical assistance (TA) grant provides funding for a Procurement Advisor and a Technical Transportation Procurement Expert, collectively referred to as Advisors, to assist Panama's Ministry of Public Works (MOP) for a period of 18 months. The grant represents Phase III of the Procurement Assistance Program for Panama under the Global Procurement Initiative (GPI). The Advisors will provide strategic and technical procurement advice, with the goal of incorporating value-based methodologies into MOP's procurement processes. A value-based procurement system will help MOP implement sustainable, high-quality infrastructure projects and may increase opportunities for United States (U.S.) companies to bid on and potentially win tenders.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Airport and Air Traffic Management Technologies, through American Association of Airport Executives

description.narrative: The Airport and Air Traffic Management Technologies Reverse Trade Mission introduced Panamanian delegates to key U.S. technologies and best practices relating to air traffic management and airport operations, which will assist Panama as it develops a new modernization strategy for the country's aviation infrastructure.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - PANAMA: DEFINITIONAL MISSION: AVIATION SECTOR, through KED Group, LLC

description.narrative: This $45,000 Definitional Mission (DM) evaluates aviation project opportunities at several airports in Panama. Proposals were submitted to USTDA by the Panama Civil Aviation Authority (Autoridad Aeronautica Civil or "AAC") and the Aeropuerto Internacional de Tocumen, S.A.

title.narrative: Smart Grid Investment Roadmap, through Quanta Technology, LLC

description.narrative: The Smart Grid Investment Roadmap Technical Assistance will support the Panamanian energy ministry's efforts to develop a regulatory framework that would advance the deployment of smart grid technologies in the country. The project will foster smart grid technology investments that would accommodate new renewable sources of energy, improve the reliability of the power grid, and expand energy efficiency management.

title.narrative: Anton Valley Geothermal Power Project, through Blackrock Geoscience

description.narrative: This would partially fund a feasibility study for the Anton Valley Geothermal Power Project, which would be one of the first geothermal power plants in Panama. The Grantee and project sponsor is Playa San Antonio, S.A. and the sole-source Contractor is Blackrock Geoscience, P.C. of Pocatello, Idaho.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - NextGen Air Traffic Management, through Boeing Company

description.narrative: This NextGen Air Traffic Management technical assistance grant provides the Panama's Autoridad Aeronutica Civil with recommendations for the installation of advanced communications, navigation, and surveillance systems to improve air safety within the country's airspace and at major airports. The grant will assist in enhancing communications, navigation, surveillance, and air traffic management capabilities within Panama and its flight information region, as well as meeting International Civil Aviation Organization mandates for global interoperability.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Tocumen International Airport Strategic Devlopment Plan, through Government of Panama

description.narrative: This $795,600 feasibility study grant for the Tocumen International Aiport Strategic Development Plan will guide the near-term expansion of passenger and cargo infrastructure and operations at Panama's largest airport by Aeropuerto Internacional de Tocumen, S.A. The expansion of Tocumen International Airport would support a goal of Panama's 2010-2014 National Strategic Plan to position the country as a major transportation hub in the Latin America and Caribbean Region.
